intro: Alsine alsinastrum, commonly known as bladder campion, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, inflated seed pods that resemble bladders. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with slender stems and small, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, and it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. Bladder campion is often found in fields, along roadsides, and in dry meadows.
